sentence.Network_en: Mark was out of earshot, walking ahead of them.
sentence.Network_cn: 马克走在前面，听不见他们的声音。

sentence.Network_en: Shaun was in the bedroom, out of earshot, watching television.
sentence.Network_cn: 肖恩在卧室里看电视，听不见。

sentence.Network_en: It is within earshot of a main road.
sentence.Network_cn: 那里能够听见大马路的车水马龙声。

encyclopedia.content: 充满著浓厚美式摇滚的Earshot虽然是于1999年于洛杉矶成军，但国籍却横跨了美国、奥地利及法国等不同地域。起初他们成军之时本想组成一支重摇滚乐团，但经一翻讨论思考后，取而代之的是更有旋律性，也各具词意内涵的创作精神；他们爆发力十足的现场表演，无论在摇滚火力猛度与情感流泄上，都再再吸引住无数摇滚客的目光，也使他们成军才短短一年即被签入Warner Bros唱片旗下。 “Letting Go”是Earshot的首张专辑，藉由Wil接连不断

entry.tran: 在听力范围之内/在听力范围之外
entry.def: If you are within earshot of someone or something, you are close enough to be able to hear them. If you are out of earshot, you are too far away to hear them.

example.ex: It is within earshot of a main road...
example.tran: 那里能够听见大马路的车水马龙声。

example.ex: Mark was out of earshot, walking ahead of them.
example.tran: 马克走在前面，听不见他们的声音。

means.word_mean: 1. the range within which a voice can be heard;

sentences.sentence: "the children were told to stay within earshot"
